data.title: Big Soccer Complex in Dallas Suburbs
data.text: This is a big soccer complex ... depending on where you park, you might be in for a walk to the field your child is playing on. Bring the bug spray and the sun tan lotion. I would give the complex five stars if it had a little more sophisticated concessions set-up and they could use at least another set of restrooms for the number of fields.

data.title: Soccer tournament facilities
data.text: We attended a soccer tournament @ the Toyota Soccer Complex.  The fields were marked well and well maintained.  The complex, however, has only one small concession stand and a small bathroom.  Considering the  number of fields and the number of people attending this is inadequate!!!!

data.title: Support FC Dallas!
data.text: My family loves watching FC Dallas - it's close, not too expensive and it keeps my children entertained! Food is ok and again not as expensive as other sports!

data.title: Awesome venue!!
data.text: Great location!!  The staff was eager to assist in helping to find your seats. Restroom lines moved quickly.  We were there for the Jimmy Buffett concert.  All of our group has been there several times and always enjoyed our day at this venue.  However, we think parking prices are getting too high.  Yes people will pay the price to enjoy the day and to see the performer.  But, the prices are getting out of line.  Port a potties used to be supplied in various parts of the parking lots but, not anymore!!  You can have one for your party for $100.

data.title: Excellent location, myriad of activities
data.text: Frisco is a sports-centric City and Frisco Soccer Complex adds significantly to that image. Come here on any weekend when the weather is nice and most of the town is around in the area. Frisco Soccer Association is picking up quite some local popularity for the soccer awareness they are generating in their youth programs. Frisco Soccer complex contributes and hosts a lot of league matches at various proficiency levels.

data.title: NCAA Championship game
data.text: Great venue for the football game. Comfortable seating and easy access to all areas that we needed to go to.

data.title: Wish all tournament facilities were like this one.
data.text: Despite large number of fields, never felt like we had to walk too far to get from one to another. Nice pathways, bleachers at each field and canopies set up for each team. Clean bathrooms. Ample parking on both sides. Multiple entrances to make it easier to get to a field quickly. Located near hotels and several good restaurants.

data.title: Great time, but medicore product on the field
data.text: Toyota Stadium is not a bad place to go and watch soccer. There really isn't a bad seat and now that they decided to add bleachers where the stage is, it make sit feel like it is sold out. The Beer Garden is the best part of the stadium. Parking isn't too bad unless it is the Fourth of July, but the stadium doesn't have any control of the traffic patterns set by FPD. Food is a bit pricey which is expected.

data.title: Superb place to watch soccer
data.text:
This is the way stadiums for soccer should be like
I don't think there is a bad seat. Wonderful and not to be missed in Frisco

data.title: Graduation time in Frisco
data.text: Great place for a sporting complex.  Also very good for graduations.  Parking adjacent  and  lots of escalators to keep crowds moving and elevators for people with disabilities. Many concession stands on each level.

data.title: Great place for kids to play
data.text: Its nice to see local communities provide something as nice as this group of fields. We had plenty of parking options even though there were many people there. I can see where it could get crowded.

data.title: Summertime Blues
data.text:
We stopped at the stadium for a Jimmy Buffett show.  Traffic heading into the venue was smooth and it was easy to find parking.  The parking was very pricey for this kind of venue.  We found that the parking ran from $30 for cars to $160 for motorhomes.  The tailgating was well spaced and well under control.  Getting into the stadium was very easy, a quick bag check and ticket scan and we were in without issue.  There were the expected long lines for the food stands and the restrooms.

We were about half way down the field from the stage and found the seats to be very comfortable.  The sound inside the stadium was well balanced.

This was definitely a fun place to see a show, just glad we had nice weather!

Leaving it took under 20 minutes from when we started our car until we were up to full speed on the freeway.

data.title: Jimmy Buffet Concert
data.text: A great venue to have this concert. The seats are comfortable and the view of the stage was excellent! Had no problem getting into and out of the ladies restroom promptly. Felt the concessions were rather high ($4 for a bottle of water) but guess that's typical. Lots of staff on hand to help finding seats, etc. All in all a great concert at a great venue! :)

data.title: Shocked at parking prices
data.text: Made my first visit to the Frisco Soccer Complex to see a Jimmy Buffett "Event."  Concert, including opening act John Fogerty, was superb.  Stadium was great.  Restrooms were clean, food vendors were working hard to keep up with demand, and seats were comfortable.  My only complaint was the price of parking.  As I stated this was my first visit to the Toyota Center and couldn't believe that parking fees went from $30.00 (furthest away from the venue) to $160.00 for RV parking with VIP parking nearest the stadium.  Guess I am spoiled with $5.00 to $20.00 parking where I am from.

data.title: Good Game
data.text: Love the complex.  There is not a bad seat in the place. Have always had a good time we have attended a game.

data.title: Great complex
data.text: Great Stadium.  Parking wasn't bad.  Food was good in the stadium.  Loved the little food and shopping area right next to the complex.

data.title: Sports fields galore!
data.text: Soccer everywhere.  This is a great facility.   I you like outdoor soccer for you or your friends, this is the spot.  Lots of space and well maintained fields.

data.title: Great place for kids
data.text: my kids have been playing there for a long time is a great place for sports, I'll recommend this place for all families

data.title: Great place- terrible parking/traffic
data.text: This is a fantastic facility.  But the complain year after year is parking.  It takes a good 15-20 minutes to find a spot during the busier times, so you must give yourself extra time.  Getting out of the complex is always a nightmare.  I'm hoping the new traffic lights will help with that issue.

data.title: Complex
data.text: Complex well laid out and great condition for games.  Event was run very professionally, easy access to fields and parking.
